author: MICHAEL ADKISON | KEYE Staff
title: chevron-right
text: {p}The man shot and killed by officers Tuesday at a Texas apartment complex was carrying a BB gun, not a rifle as police originally reported, the department confirmed Wednesday.{/p}{p}{sd-embed class=\"sd-embedded-media\" data-alt=\"KEYE\" data-caption=\"Man%20fatally%20shot%20by%20officers%20at%20Texas%20apartment%20complex%20was%20holding%20BB%20gun,%20police%20say%20(KEYE)\" data-duration=\"163.072\" data-externalid=\"fb6aac852fca43639f94838cfaa15c7e\" data-mediatype=\"video\" data-renditions=\"\" data-thumburl=\"/resources/media/82177ca6-0726-4896-8b6f-905568ba6e1a-medium16x9_thumb_61595.png\" data-title=\"Man%20fatally%20shot%20by%20officers%20at%20Texas%20apartment%20complex%20was%20holding%20BB%20gun,%20police%20say\" data-url=\"https://content.uplynk.com/fb6aac852fca43639f94838cfaa15c7e.m3u8?tc=1&exp=1703869728&rn=1526628551&ct=a&cid=fb6aac852fca43639f94838cfaa15c7e&hlsver=7&sig=362be031e5decfbca71e1e2f6130e5971a411140283c9fd7f3301f40b3301d35\" data-defaultthumb=\"\" data-embed-file=\"%3Cdiv%20class=%22sda-VideoEmbed%22%3E%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%3Cdiv%20class=%22sda-video-media%22%3E%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%3Ciframe%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20width=%22560%22%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20height=%22315%22%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20class=%22sda-embeded-player-iframe%20sda-VideoEmbed-iframe%22%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20src=%22/resources/embeds/vod.html?externalId=fb6aac852fca43639f94838cfaa15c7e%22%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20frameborder=%22no%22%3E%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%3C/iframe%3E%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%3C/div%3E%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%3Cdiv%20class=%22sda-video-info%22%3E%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%3Cimg%20class=%22sda-VideoEmbed-stopImage%22%20src=%22/resources/media/82177ca6-0726-4896-8b6f-905568ba6e1a-medium16x9_thumb_61595.png%22/%3E%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%3Cdiv%20class=%22sda-VideoEmbed-caption%22%3E%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%3Cspan%3ECaption:%20Man%20fatally%20shot%20by%20officers%20at%20Texas%20apartment%20complex%20was%20holding%20BB%20gun,%20police%20say%20(KEYE)%3C/span%3E%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%3C/div%3E%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%3C/div%3E%0A%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%20%3C/div%3E\" data-embed-type=\"video\" contenteditable=\"false\"}{/sd-embed}{/p}{p}KEYE broke the story after Interim Police Chief Robin Henderson had first noted in a news briefing Tuesday evening that, just a minute before an officer pulled the trigger, that \"he was unsure if it was a rifle or a BB gun.‚Äù{br}{/p}{p}{sd-embed class=\"sd-embedded-media\" data-embed-file=\"1740132297880547612\" data-embed-type=\"twitter\" contenteditable=\"false\"}{/sd-embed}{/p}{p}Reporters from at least five outlets were only allowed to ask three total questions in Tuesday's briefing, so KEYE was unable to get immediate clarification on the nature of the weapon allegedly held by the victim. A KEYE reporter did ask specifically how many shots were fired and if the weapon put anyone in immediate danger, to which Henderson only said the investigation was ongoing.{br}{/p}{p}Police confirmed the object was a BB gun on Wednesday.{/p}{p}Tuesday's shooting marked the fourth officer-involved shooting in December, including one last week, and one during the December 5 violent spree, in which {a href=\"https://thenationaldesk.com/top-videos/police-say-shooting-spree-suspect-murdered-parents-in-san-antonio-before-austin-killings\" target=\"_blank\" title=\"https://thenationaldesk.com/top-videos/police-say-shooting-spree-suspect-murdered-parents-in-san-antonio-before-austin-killings\"}six people were killed{/a} and three people, including two officers, were injured.{/p}{p}In an unrelated event on Wednesday morning, Henderson told reporters the police force was still facing a shortage of about 340 officers. Law enforcement advocates said that shortage might further contribute to high-stress responses.{/p}{p}\"By not providing adequate staffing to the department, you are fostering an environment where officers are overworked; where they are stressed; where they are having to do more than just their 40 assigned hours,\" Michael Bullock, the president-elect of the Austin Police Association, said on Wednesday before police confirmed the weapon was a BB gun. \"Ultimately, we're fostering this environment where you're setting officers up to be involved in these situations more.\"{/p}{p}During Tuesday's briefing, Henderson said that officers initially responded around 1:18 p.m. to reports of a man firing what was believed to be a rifle in the parking lot of a northeast Austin apartment building.{/p}{p}The first officers on scene reported seeing the man point what they believed was a rifle at them as they drove through the lot.{/p}{p}The man continued pointing the weapon at the officers as they took cover behind vehicles in the parking lot. Over the radio, an officer stated that they were not sure if it was a rifle or a BB gun. He continued to point the weapon at officers as they ordered him to drop it.{ }{/p}{p}One officer opened fire, striking him. Officers rendered aid, but he was pronounced dead at the scene.
